titleStmt.title: A briefe apologie, or defence of the Catholike ecclesiastical hierarchie, & subordination in England erected these later yeares by our holy father Pope Clement the eyght; and impugned by certayne libels printed & published of late both in Latyn & English; by some vnquiet persons vnder the name of priests of the seminaries. VVritten and set forth for the true information and stay of all good Catholikes, by priests vnited in due subordination to the Right Reuerend Archpriest, and other their superiors.
titleStmt.author: Parsons, Robert, 1546-1610.

titleStmt.title: A briefe apologie, or defence of the Catholike ecclesiastical hierarchie, & subordination in England erected these later yeares by our holy father Pope Clement the eyght; and impugned by certayne libels printed & published of late both in Latyn & English; by some vnquiet persons vnder the name of priests of the seminaries. VVritten and set forth for the true information and stay of all good Catholikes, by priests vnited in due subordination to the Right Reuerend Archpriest, and other their superiors.
titleStmt.author: Parsons, Robert, 1546-1610.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A. Conincx] Permissu superiorum,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Robert Parsons by STC (2nd ed.).
A passage is often effaced on leaf 201r in accordance with a request in the "Appendix" (STC 19392.5), E2r.
Identified as STC 19392 on reel 931 and STC 4832 on reel 1301.
Reproductions of the originals in the Folger Shakespeare Library (reel 931) and Marsh's Library (reel 1301).
Bound with: An appendix to the apologie. [Antwerp : A. Conincx, 1602].
